headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Caging the "Alligator"--Branch Committed to the Penitentiary--His Friends "See Him Over the River." For the Gold Regions. Monthly Report of the Dispensaries of the City of New-York, for the Month of July, 1838. THE COMING PRIZE FIGHT. SUICIDE BY TAKING LAUDANUM. PROBABLY FATAL STABBING. Coroners' Inquests. Fires. ?? Found in the River. Police Intelligence.

docs.lead_paragraph: The sentence of the law, as pronounced by Resorvoir BAHNARD, was yesterday carried out against STEPHEN H. BRANCH, for libeis published in the Alligator, and he was removed from the City Prison to Blackwell's Island. Deputy Sheriff SIMPSON, have received the order of commitment, arrived ?? headline.main: LETTERS FROM SUMMER RESORTS.; A Night on the Summit of Mount Washington--The "Tip-Top House"--Cold Weather in July. THE WHITE MOUNTAINS.

docs.lead_paragraph: We had a pleasant evening at CRANFORD'S, and were up bright and early on Friday for our mountaian-ride. The "fixing " occupied much time, but we were on the ponies by 8 o'clock, or thereabouts. Such a grotesque and jolly party cannot be described. We men were well wrapped in woollen jackets and heavy plaids, while the ladies had broad straw hats, and any quantity of shawling.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Moses Taylor, Capt. JOHN McGOWAN, sails to-day for Aspinwall, with a full load of passengers and the California mails. Among others, a party of scientific gentlemen, who are bound to Peru to make observations of the great solar eclipse in September; they go out under the auspices of the Smithsonian Institution,

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Note Haven Journal. Judge MORRIS has shown us the following copy of a will recorded on the New-Haven Probate Records: "In the name of God, sole Governor of all worlds, Jesus Christ, the Holy Ghost, the twelve Apostles, Saints, Throles, Powers, Virtues, Angels, Arecangeis, Cherubims and Seraphims, Amen.

docs.snippet: COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS. Before the Hon. Recorder Barnard. The Court-room was crowded again yesterday, when Mr. ASHMEAD. counsel for STEPHEN II. BRANCH, commenced his address to the jury for the defence. He spoke for about an hour and a half, and...

headline.main: TRIAL OF STEPHEN H. BRANCH.; Second Day-His Conviction, Remarkable Speech and Sentence--Extraordinary Scene in Court. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS.

docs.lead_paragraph: COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS. Before the Hon. Recorder Barnard. The Court-room was crowded again yesterday, when Mr. ASHMEAD. counsel for STEPHEN II. BRANCH, commenced his address to the jury for the defence. He spoke for about an hour and a half, and spoke ably. For the prosecution, in reply, Mr. JOHN McKEON addressed the Jury for about the same time.

headline.main: SEA AND SHIP NEWS.; Sailing of the Moses Taylor--Departure of the Astronomical Expedition to Brazil--The Great September Eclipse.

docs.lead_paragraph: The sailing of the Pacific Mail steamer Moses Taylor,to-day, for Aspinwall, is an occasion of more than ordinary interest, as, in addition to the large number of enthusiastic gold-seekers on board, several gentleman distinguished in the scientific world take passage by her, who are bound to Peru under the auspices of the Smithsonian Institution, the entire patty having been favored with a free passage to go and return. docs.snippet: Brooklyn Items. BOARD OF HEALTH,--A meeting of this Board was held yesterday. Several nuisances were reported and ordered to be abated. An application for permission to land bales of cotton from ship Constantine, for immediate shipment to Liverpool,...
docs.lead_paragraph: Brooklyn Items. BOARD OF HEALTH,--A meeting of this Board was held yesterday. Several nuisances were reported and ordered to be abated. An application for permission to land bales of cotton from ship Constantine, for immediate shipment to Liverpool, was refused, because the Health officer's certificate at Quarantine was not produced.

headline.main: EUROPE.; OPERATIONS IN INDIA AND CHINA. Cotton and Breadstuffs Dull-Provisions Drooping. Further Outbreaks in Asiatic Turkey. ARRIVAL OF THE PERSIA. THE TELEGRAPHIC ENTERPRISE. PASSAGE OF THE INDIA BILL. Final Passage of the Oaths Bill through the House of Commons,

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamer Persia, C. H. E. JUDKINS, Esq., commander, from Liverpool at 9 o'clock on Saturday, the 24th ult., arrived at this port yesterday morning. The steamship City of Baltimore, from Halifax on the 11th July, arrived out at Liverpool at 11 o'clock P.M. on the 22d.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE SIXTH WARD MURDER--MORE ARRESTS--CORONER'S INQUEST.--The Police are still earnestly engaged in endevoring to discover the parties implicated in the murder of Cornelins Rady, the old in an who was killed on Saturday night, at the corner of Worth and Centre streets. John Quinlan, Jarnes Hines, Bernard Dwyer and Charles W. Glogan, have been arreted on suspicion.
